::Battera::

She chuckled for the final time. "Because you reminded me of me." She 
stopped chuckling and just looked at him.
"I too had lost friends. But it was in an ambush in a ship. Only I 
didn't stay to fight." She looked down.  She was still ashamed of her 
actions.
"I...I was a coward. I fled.  I was trapped with them, but instead of 
fighting, I crawled through a vent shaft and escaped."  She turned 
her back to him. "I turned tail and ran. I lost all those whom I had 
known.  Instead of fighting like I should have, I left them to be 
butchered."  She turned and faced him.
"I too know what the pain is and I also know what it can do to you. 
It can make you bitter, mean, uncaring, even cruel to others. I know, 
for I was like that.  I thought no one could help me.  But I found 
out that I was wrong.  I did find somebot who showed me that hanging 
on to the pain of the past will lead to nothing good.  I had to let 
go of most of the pain and try to go on.  I hated both sides, 
Maximal, Predacons, all of them.  But the truth is, it wasn't the 
maximals or the Preds that I hated so much, it was the hate that I 
had for myself.  And I still do somewhat." She turned her back to him.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Rex::
> 
> Rex raises an eyebrow, not finding anything humorous about the 
situation, but 
> nothing dangerous either. He puts away his pistol, walking over to 
retrieve 
> his other gun. He stops short of the other gun as he realizes that 
she had 
> said that she had been thinking of him.
> 
> "Why were you thinking of me?" he asks her, taking a few steps 
forward and 
> picking up his other gun.
